intro: Ranunculus nemorosus proles delacourii, commonly known as Delacour's wood anemone, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically features palmate leaves and produces flowers with five to eight petal-like sepals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in some areas.
